attributes.action: Make it Illegal to Profit from Selling Animals and Breeding for Commercial Gain
attributes.additional_details:
Every year, thousands of dogs are abandoned or surrendered, and too many animals are left to suffer due to overcrowded rescue centres. Yet, breeders continue to profit by producing more puppies, often without considering the impact on the welfare of the animals or the strain on rescue organisations.
Many dogs are bred excessively, often resulting in serious health and behavioural issues.
Some breeders subject animals to poor living conditions, neglect, and abuse to maximize their profits.
attributes.background:
Implement stricter regulations on animal breeding to ensure that only responsible, ethical breeders are allowed to breed animals, focused on the welfare of the animals, not profit.
Increase support for rescue shelters, helping them reduce the number of abandoned pets and improve rehoming efforts.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petitions, which call for similar action: 

Increase funding and support for animal rescue and rehabilitation organisations.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/700310

Stricter regulations on the breeding and sale/adoption of pets
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/707248

Introduce breeder licences, a dog database & harsher punishments for dog abuse
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/701598
